sourceDesc.p: Mary Behrend, who founded Penn State Behrend, wrote notes to her husband on daily calender pages. Included were poems, jokes, and small illustrations. This is the encoded version of the page for March 17, 1909, St. Patrick's Day!

gs.desc: A page-wide line made up of hyphens

dateline.style: Large lettering, with an extravagant green 'M'

graphic.desc: Small snakes and three-leaf clovers are drawn around the page. There are two snakes, and four clovers.

body.p: St. Patrick was a useful saint
He frightened all the snakes away-
I wish he'd try his art on smoke

gap.desc: No other text until the bottom of the page

graphic.desc: A small drawing of what appears to be a factory sits above the note at the bottom of the page, presumably Hammermill.
